clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Outcome Study of ARC1779 Injection in Patients With Thrombotic Microangiopathy
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo Controlled, Clinical Outcome Study of ARC1779 Injection in Patients With Thrombotic Microangiopathy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this ascending-dose research study is to determine whether the administration of ARC1779 Injection improves subject's health profile by protecting the brain, heart, and kidney from damage due to formation of small blood clots in blood vessels. It will also determine the safety of ARC1779 Injection, how ARC1779 Injection enters and leaves the blood and tissue over time, and its effect on laboratory tests related to blood clotting, heart and brain function, and other body systems.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Enrollment into study was slower than expected.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of the clinical composite of death (all-cause mortality), stroke, coma, seizures, renal failure, or acute myocardial infarction (AMI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Neurocognitive function is to be assessed with the CogState® test system.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Once during the hospitalization period and again at the 6 week clinic visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of death, stroke, or acute renal failure/injury requiring dialysis is to be assessed.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the extended clinical follow-up for each patient from the time of the 6 week clinic visit until the study is closed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety- and efficacy-related clinical laboratory parameters and biomarkers will be analyzed in relation to ARC1779 exposure in terms of the dose administered and the observed plasma concentration.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During initial hospitalization and at 6 week clinic visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of the composite of complications associated with plasma exchange therapy (i.e., catheter-related infection, thrombosis, internal hemorrhage, or pneumothorax) is to be assessed.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During initial hospitalization and at the 6 week clinic visit.

intervention.description: ARC1779 Injection or placebo is administered intravenously to patients as an initial loading dose followed by continuous infusion of up to 14 days plus 2 day taper.
